thread.title: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide
thread.title_full: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide

author: PETE IACOBELLI
title: Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide
text:
Richard Shiro Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
South Carolina head football coach Steve Spurrier speaks at a news conference to announce he is resigning on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, at the University Of South Carolina, in Columbia, S.C. Spurrier said he felt he needed to step down now because he doesn't believe there is accountability with players if they know the coach won't be back next year. He also said he was a recruiting liability. He had never had a losing season in 25 previous seasons coach at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001) or South Carolina, where he has been since 2005. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro) Richard Shiro Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
South Carolina head football coach Steve Spurrier waits to speak during a news conference held to announce he is resigning on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, at the University Of South Carolina, in Columbia, S.C. Spurrier said he felt he needed to step down now because he doesn't believe there is accountability with players if they know the coach won't be back next year. He also said he was a recruiting liability. He had never had a losing season in 25 previous seasons coach at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001) or South Carolina, where he has been since 2005. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro) Richard Shiro Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
South Carolina's new interim head coach Sean Elliott speaks during a news conference after Steve Spurrier announced he was resigning on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, at the University Of South Carolina, in Columbia, S.C. Steve Spurrier said he made the decision to resign as head coach because the team was heading in the wrong direction. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro) Richard Shiro Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
South Carolina's new interim head coach Sean Elliott speaks during a news conference after Steve Spurrier announced he was resigning on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, at the University Of South Carolina, in Columbia, S.C. Steve Spurrier said he made the decision to resign as head coach because the team was heading in the wrong direction. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro) Richard Shiro Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
South Carolina head football coach Steve Spurrier speaks during a news conference to announce he is resigning on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, at the University Of South Carolina, in Columbia, S.C. Spurrier said he felt he needed to step down now because he doesn't believe there is accountability with players if they know the coach won't be back next year. He also said he was a recruiting liability. He had never had a losing season in 25 previous seasons coach at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001) or South Carolina, where he has been since 2005. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro) Richard Shiro Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
South Carolina head football coach Steve Spurrier speaks during a news conference to announce he is resigning on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, at the University Of South Carolina, in Columbia, S.C. Spurrier said he felt he needed to step down now because he doesn't believe there is accountability with players if they know the coach won't be back next year. He also said he was a recruiting liability. He had never had a losing season in 25 previous seasons coach at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001) or South Carolina, where he has been since 2005. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro) Richard Shiro Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
South Carolina head football coach Steve Spurrier speaks at a news conference to announce he is resigning on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, at the University Of South Carolina, in Columbia, S.C. Spurrier said he felt he needed to step down now because he doesn't believe there is accountability with players if they know the coach won't be back next year. He also said he was a recruiting liability. He had never had a losing season in 25 previous seasons coach at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001) or South Carolina, where he has been since 2005. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro) Richard Shiro Appreciation: Spurrier changed the game, did things his way 
South Carolina head football coach Steve Spurrier speaks at a news conference to announce he is resigning on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, at the University Of South Carolina, in Columbia, S.C. Spurrier said he felt he needed to step down now because he doesn't believe there is accountability with players if they know the coach won't be back next year. He also said he was a recruiting liability. He had never had a losing season in 25 previous seasons coach at Duke (1987-89), Florida (1990-2001) or South Carolina, where he has been since 2005. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro) John Bazemore Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
FILE - In this Saturday, Sept. 19, 2015, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier directs his team from the sideline during the first half of an NCAA college football game against Georgia in Athens, Ga. A person close to the situation says Spurrier told his team on Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, that he was retiring, effective immediately. The person spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because South Carolina has not publicly announced Spurrier's decision or who will be interim coach. (AP Photo/John Bazemore, File) James Crisp Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide 
FILE - in this Sept. 29, 2012 file photo, South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier gestures to an official during the first quarter of an NCAA college football game against Kentucky in Lexington, Ky. A person close to the situation says Spurrier told his team on Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, that he was retiring, effective immediately. The person spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because South Carolina has not publicly announced Spurrier's decision or who will be interim coach. (AP Photo/James Crisp) Spurrier resigns, takes blame for South Carolina's slide Associated Press | 
COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — Steve Spurrier knew it was time. South Carolina was struggling and the gregarious and once innovative coach was a big reason why. Always one to do things his way, Spurrier believed he needed to step aside, and no one was going to change his mind. 
Spurrier resigned as Gamecocks coach Tuesday, resisting pleas from the University of South Carolina president and athletic director to stay through the season — accepting the harsh reality that the team's awful first half was on him.
